title: Ticket #7570: HTCondor should be able generate delegated RFC 3820 proxies if desired
description:
There are three proxy formats in globus: old, draft-RFC, and RFC.

Currently, HTCondor does a few different things when delegating a proxy it has a few different behaviors. Generally it preserves the format on delegation, but for an End Entity Credential it generates a draft-RFC version. It was hypothesized that some services may not accept this format and we should generate an RFC 3820 compliant one instead.

This would be a simple rework of the switch statement in condor_utils/globus_utils.cpp:x509_send_delegation()

Probably we'll create yet another know to control this behavior, set the default in stable to the old behavior and change the default in devel to the new behavior.
